ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to think critically and translate that into my writing, also how to engage with scholarly material and discuss the themes in a group setting.

- interesting perspective on various views of ecology
- Indigenous and Black intersection within colonialism and the influence on ecology
- improved my analytical writing skills
Insight into critical theories and exposure to incredible pieces written by leaders of thought in black and indigenous ecologies, decolonialization
This course really taught me the value of discussing our thoughts and how to articulate those thoughts and share our opinions, and viewpoints. Also that everyones unique input is valuable.

I learned how to be a more skilled and effective writer. I have also gained much experience working with primary literature sources and how to discuss and analyze them in a constructive manner. Finally, I have also engaged with much post colonial works that have afforded me a richer understanding of the social relations that structure our modern world.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Rasheed was absolutely amazing!! He made a very open, safe environment for us to discuss and gave us many things to think about (very very insightful). Weaknesses: Sometimes we would go on very long, kind of unrelated tangents that would take up all of class and we didn't get to the plan for the day and kept getting pushed back. Would've loved some more structure and boundaries within the class to ensure we got done what we needed to. Aldo would've appreciated more focus on writing skills (How to write a strong intro and conclusion, how to incorporate quotes tastefully, how to build a strong argument, etc) rather than just focusing on the readings - though that was really good as well.

strengths: welcoming and accepting class environment, great understanding professor
weaknesses: structure of discussions

Strengths: Exposure to intersectional and interdisciplinary work that can inform thought and practice of students from other fields, flexibility in pursuing material with a twist of what interests each student, class direction adapts to interest of students

This course was structured in a very organized manner that facilitated class discussion. I always felt like an active participant in class and learned equally as much from my fellow classmates as I did from the professor. The syllabus covered a broad scope of influential texts whilst also simultaneously not overwhelming me with work. Rasheed was a super kind and understanding professor who was always there for us and greatly enhanced my class experience. The overall workload in terms of assignment was also very manageable and I legitimately enjoyed writing every single essay. I particularly loved the last two papers (the creative project and research paper) as they allowed me to creatively explore subjects that had always fascinated me but still in a constructive manner.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 100% Professor is amazing, and the material is super interesting!!

Yes, I would definitely recommend this course with Rasheed. He is a very supportive professor and it is clear he wants all of his students to succeed. The course material was also very interesting and like nothing else I've interacted with before.
Yes definitely- take this class even if it seems a little outside your current comfort range/past academic work!

I would highly recommend this course to any student even remotely interested in this topic. Rasheed is an absolute phenomenal professor and a gem of a person too. He truly loves the material and cares for his students and their learning experience. Our class would often stay after class for hours at end not wanting to end our discussion of that day's reading material.
